com.tinkerpop.gremlin.process

Interface Step<S,E>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - The incoming object type of the step
    E - The outgoing object type of the step
    All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Iterator<Traverser<E>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStep, AddEdgeStep, AggregateStep, BackStep, BarrierStep, BranchStep, ChooseStep, ComputerResultStep, CountStep, CyclicPathStep, DedupStep, EdgeOtherVertexStep, EdgeVertexStep, EmptyStep, ExceptStep, FilterStep, FlatMapStep, FoldStep, GraphStep, GroupByStep, GroupCountStep, HadoopGraphStep, HasStep, IdentityStep, IdStep, InjectStep, IntervalStep, JumpStep, KeyStep, LabelStep, LocalRangeStep, MapStep, MarkerIdentityStep, MatchStep, Neo4jCypherStep, Neo4jGraphStep, OrderByStep, OrderStep, PageRankStep, PathIdentityStep, PathStep, ProfileStep, PropertiesStep, PropertyElementStep, PropertyMapStep, PropertyValueStep, RandomStep, RangeStep, RetainStep, SackElementValueStep, SackObjectStep, SackStep, SelectOneStep, SelectStep, ShuffleStep, SideEffectCapStep, SideEffectStep, SimplePathStep, StartStep, StoreStep, StrategyWrappedGraphStep, SubgraphStep, SumStep, TimeLimitStep, TinkerGraphStep, TreeStep, UnfoldStep, UnionStep, UntilStep, VertexStep, WhereStep

    public interface Step<S,E>
extends Iterator<Traverser<E>>, Cloneable
    A Step denotes a unit of computation within a Traversal. A step takes an incoming object and yields an outgoing object. Steps are chained together in a Traversal to yield a lazy function chain of computation.

    In the constructor of a Step, never store explicit sideEffect objects in Traversal.SideEffects. If a sideEffect needs to be registered with the Traversal, use SideEffects.registerSupplier().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Step.NoObject
      A static singleton denoting that the current "spot" in the Step contains no object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Step.NoObject NO_OBJECT
      A token object that denotes "nothing" and is used to declare an empty "spot" in a Traversal

      • setTraversal

        void setTraversal(Traversal<?,?> traversal)
        Set the Traversal that this step is contained within.
        Parameters:
        traversal - the new traversal for this step

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset the state of the step such that it has no incoming starts. Internal states are to be reset, but any sideEffect data structures are not to be recreated.

      • clone

        Step<S,E> clone()
         throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Cloning is used to duplicate steps for the purpose of traversal optimization and OLTP replication. When cloning a step, it is important that the steps, the cloned step is equivalent to the state of the step when reset() is called. Moreover, the previous and next steps should be set to EmptyStep.
        Returns:
        The cloned step
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException

      • getLabel

        String getLabel()
        Get the label of this step.
        Returns:
        the label of the step

        void setLabel(String label)
        Set the label of this step.
        Parameters:
        label - the label for this step
